attributes.action: Force liability to go back vaccine manufacturers
attributes.background: In the present situation if something goes wrong with vaccination, and injury occurs, crazily, manufacturers of the vaccines are not held liable and instead the governments are. This is a major thing that needs changing. This seeks for the government to undo that and make the manufacturers liable.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The Vaccine Damage Payments Act 1979 established in the UK a statutory no-fault system of a single lump sum payment from public funds for cases of proven serious permanent disablement resulting from Government-approved vaccination.

https://www.gov.uk/vaccine-damage-payment

The Vaccine Damage Payment scheme is not intended to be compensation and doesn't prevent a person from pursuing a claim against the manufacturer of the vaccine. You can read more about this here:

https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2015-03-24/debates/15032478000001/VaccineDamagePaymentsAct
